article.headline: Gardner-Webb 105, Charleston Southern 77
article.story: BOILING SPRINGS, N.C. (AP) -- Thomas Sanders had 22 points and 10 rebounds, and Gardner-Webb snapped a four-game losing streak by beating Charleston Southern 105-77 on Saturday night. Aaron Linn also scored 22 points and Grayson Flittner added 18 for the Runnin' Bulldogs (6-8), who shot 52 percent and made 13 of 23 3-pointers in avenging an 11-point loss to Charleston Southern on Dec. 15. Gardner-Webb held a 47-35 rebounding advantage, had 23 assists to the Bucs' 10 and committed just eight turnovers. The Runnin' Bulldogs had 19 giveaways in each of their last two losses. Jemarco Warren finished with 19 points to lead Charleston Southern (5-7), which has lost five of seven since starting 3-2. Omar Carter scored 12 points and Shelton Carter added 10 for the Bucs, who lost despite shooting 40 percent. Gardner-Webb improved to 3-1 at home and is averaging 96.75 points in those games at Paul Porter Arena.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
